org.apache.flex.compiler.css

Interface ICSSSelector

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ICSSNode, ISourceLocation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CSSSelector

    public interface ICSSSelector
extends ICSSNode
    Model for CSS3 selectors. A ICSSRule has one or many selectors connected by combinators. Currently, only descendant combinator is supported.

    A selector can optionally have one or many ICSSSelectorCondition's.

    Some of the W3C specifications and API might call this a "simple selector". Since we do not implement the whole W3C SAC API stack, there's no concept of "complex" selector. That's why it is called a "selector" instead of a "simple selector".

    See Also:
    css3 selectors

    • Method Detail

      • getCombinator

        ICSSCombinator getCombinator()
        Get the combinator of this selector if it exists. A combinator is the selector on the left-hand side of the current selector.
        Returns:
        A combinator or null;

      • getElementName

        String getElementName()
        Get the element name. For example, Label is the element name for "s|Label.noBorder".
        Returns:
        Element name or null.

      • getNamespacePrefix

        String getNamespacePrefix()
        Get the namespace prefix. For example, mx is the namespace prefix for "mx|Button".
        Returns:
        Namespace prefix or null.

      • getConditions

        com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<ICSSSelectorCondition> getConditions()
        Get selector conditions.

        Example: selector conditions. 

         s|Button.rounded#main:up
        In this selector, the conditions are ".rounded", "#main" and ":up".
        Returns:
        A list of conditions.

      • getCSSSyntax

        String getCSSSyntax()
        This API is explicitly added so that no CSS compilation logic will depend on toString() value of an ICSSNode.
        Returns:
        The CSS text from which this selector is generated.

      • isAdvanced

        boolean isAdvanced()
        Check if a selector uses Flex 4 advanced syntax. An advanced selector can't be used in -compatibility-version=3 mode.
        Returns:
        True if the selector has advanced syntax.
